intro: Monnina boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian bluestem, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Monnina boliviana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal uses in traditional practices.
